intro: Borreria macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed borreria, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Borreria macrocephala is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands.
